name: K2-48
scenarioDescription:
The K2-48 Exoplanetary System

K2-48 is a star with 0.77 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.73 times its radius. It is located 1032.64 light years away from the solar system.

K2-48 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-48 b

K2-48 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.51 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-48.

The mass of K2-48 b is 6.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-48 b is 2.24 that of Earth. At 6.68 Earth masses, K2-48 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-48, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
